catalog_info.title: Well-Being
catalog_info.description: What makes someone's life go well? Is it pleasure, desire, satisfaction, or something else? How should questions of well-being bear on one's reasoning about what to do, and on one's relations with other people? Can you assess your well-being by evaluating parts of your life individually, or does it depend on the shape of your life as a whole? Readings will include work by Richard Kraut, Derek Parfit, T. M. Scanlon, J. David Velleman, and Susan Wolf, among others.
